oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Return of provisions received, issued, and remaining on hand in the field

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Indiana Volunteer Infantry, 75th; United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.; Armies -- Commissariat; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Return of provisions received, issued, and remaining on hand In the Field during the month of December 1862 by Lieutenant William A. Wainwright. Items listed include: pork, bacon, ham, salt beef, fresh beef, beef cattle, flour, hard bread, beans, peas, rice, hominy, coffee, tea sugar (brown, white), vinegar, candles, soap, salt, desicated potatoes, mixed vegetables, whiskey, molasses, and forage (hay and corn).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The senior lieutenant present (here William Alonzo Wainwright) was entitled to the appointment of Assistant Commissary of Subsistence for the regiment. Wainwright functioned as both Assistant Commissary and Assistant Quartermaster of the 75th Indiana Infantry.
